properties.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 2 at 8:22PM CST until January 2 at 11:15PM CST by NWS Jackson MS
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a

* Flash Flood Warning for...
A Dam Break in...
Central Adams County in southwestern Mississippi...

* Until 1115 PM CST.

* At 814 PM CST, county dispatch reported the imminent failure of
Robbins Lake Dam

HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding from the imminent failure
of the Robbins Lake Dam about 10 miles south of Natchez,
just west of US Highway 61.

SOURCE...Emergency Management.

IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding could occur if the dam
fails. Areas impacted would be downstream from the Dam
along Robbins Bayou towards Lower Woodville Road and
Highway 61 near Buckles Road. 8 to 10 feet of water could
be possible in areas near Lower Woodville Road.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the
dangers of flooding.

CMAMtext: NWS: FLASH FLOOD WARNING this area til 11:15 PM CST. Avoid flooded areas.
